member.name: IMF2DBuffer.ContiguousCopyFrom
member.summary: Copies data to this buffer from a buffer that has a contiguous format.
member.param: Pointer to the source buffer. The caller allocates the buffer.
Size of the source buffer, in bytes. To get the maximum size of the buffer, call .

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

member.name: IMF2DBuffer.ContiguousCopyTo
member.summary: Copies this buffer into the caller's buffer, converting the data to contiguous format.
member.param: Pointer to the destination buffer where the data will be copied. The caller allocates the buffer.
Size of the destination buffer, in bytes. To get the required size, call .

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

member.name: IMF2DBuffer.GetContiguousLength
member.summary: Retrieves the number of bytes needed to store the contents of the buffer in contiguous format.
member.param: Receives the number of bytes needed to store the contents of the buffer in contiguous format.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

member.name: IMF2DBuffer.GetScanline0AndPitch
member.summary: Retrieves a pointer to the buffer memory and the surface stride.
member.param: Receives a pointer to the first byte of the top row of pixels in the image.
Receives the stride, in bytes. For more information, see Image Stride.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: You must lock the buffer before calling this method.

member.name: IMF2DBuffer.IsContiguousFormat
member.summary: Queries whether the buffer is contiguous in its native format.
member.param: Receives a Boolean value. The value is TRUE if the buffer is contiguous, and FALSE otherwise.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

member.name: IMF2DBuffer.Lock2D
member.summary: Gives the caller access to the memory in the buffer.
member.param: Receives a pointer to the first byte of the top row of pixels in the image. The top row is defined as the top row when the image is presented to the viewer, and might not be the first row in memory.
Receives the surface stride, in bytes. The stride might be negative, indicating that the image is oriented from the bottom up in memory.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: The buffer cannot be locked at this time.

member.name: IMF2DBuffer.Unlock2D
member.summary: Unlocks a buffer that was previously locked. Call this method once for each call to .

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

member.name: IMF2DBuffer
member.summary: Represents a buffer that contains a two-dimensional surface, such as a video frame.
